instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1534 - 820-00045-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an  A1534 - 820-00045-A where the keyboard doesn't work. I've already replaced 2 other keyboards, trackpad and cables, and the keyboard still doesn't work.

I supose that the problem is on the board, but I don't know where to start.

F4800 = 8.59V
L4800 = 8.59V
PP3V3_G3H_KBD_F = 3.293V
PP5V_S0_KBD_F = 4.9V

Can you help?

threads.title: A1534 - 820-00045-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Very strange; keyboard is not connected directly to MLB.
Still not working before entering macOS, into boot menu?
Power button and SMC reset OK?

Just in case, check SMC_LID.

threads.title: A1534 - 820-00045-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi,
SMC_LID = 3.269V

I even booted with an external disk, and it doesn't work. 

With an external keyboard, the external keyboard works fine...

threads.title: A1534 - 820-00045-A no keyboard
threads.message:
Your problem is between TP and KB.
Test with known good trackpad.
